review_content:
경복궁 맥주는 광화문, 제주백록담에 이은 GS X 랜드마크 3번째 시리즈이며 이 다음으로 성산일출봉과 남산이 출시되었죠.

우선 로얄 프라이드 IPA라는 근본없는 스타일명이 거창하고 귀엽다. 직역하면 황실 자부심..인데 대충 임페리얼 느낌을 내고 싶었나..?

잔에 따라봅니다. 짙은 호박색 외관에 꾸덕하게 쏟아지는게 우선 비주얼부터 합격! 강렬합니다.

그 색을 따라온 아이보리색 거품은 조밀하고 부드럽게 피어오르며 역할을 다하네요. 로스팅맥아의 카라멜 노트 단내에 시원한 소나무 풀향이 어우러지며

혀에 닿는 맛은 검붉은 열매의 신맛에 전체적으론 미국산 홉의 산뜻하고 강렬한 풀향이 지배적이지만 꽃향과 자몽의 풍미도 있습니다.

캔에다 IPA라고 적어뒀지만 도수가 낮다보니 세션IPA 쯤이라고 생각할 수 있듯, 맛과 강도는 페일에일이기에 IPA를 기대하고 마시면 허접하게 느껴질 수 있구요.

더불어 세션IPA에서 기대할 수 있는 과즙 가득한 시트러스 풍미보다는 경복궁 맥주는 색다르게도 건포도, 건라즈베리 따위의 중후한 풍미를 가지다보니 이 부분은 경복궁 에일이란 이름과 매치가 되는 느낌?

이렇게 생각했을때 로얄 프라이드 IPA라는 작명 인정한다. 그러나 이렇게 생각되지 않는다면 경복궁 IPA라는 이름은 완죠니 불합격. 

끈적한 목넘김과 중간 정도의 바디이며 쓴맛은 IBU 30으로 어렵지 않습니다. 비교기준을 두면 많은 분들이 내색하던 플래티넘크래프트의 인생에일이 IBU 43정도..?

특이한건 연잎이 들어갔다는건데 경복궁 경회루 연못에 수놓아진 연꽃에 감명받아 연잎 가루를 첨가하여 은은하고 고풍스러운 한국적인 맛을 더 했다는데..

띠용..??

연잎을 얼마나 갈아넣었는진 알 수 없지만 느끼긴 힘듭니다. 맥주가 식고 홉향이 빠지고 나서야 뭔가 녹차 따위의 남다른 찻향이 나는 것 같긴한데

어쨋든 경복궁이란 대단한 한국적 타이틀을 쓴 특이한 연꽃 맥주라는 점, 은은한 꽃 향기와 달콤하면서도 조금은 묵직한 균형이 있다보니 마셔볼만함.

500ml can bought at Fusion in Fanling Town Centre, Fanling. 

Looks: Translucent copper brown colour with trace of misty yeast particles; Two finger head with crumpety off-white foam which last for 4 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with very fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant Amber malt, with melanoidin, strong red fruits, caramel, toffee, strong toast, floral, sugar, spices, pine, dark bread, yeast, lemon and grass.

Taste: Close to medium sweet fair Amber malt, with wheaty tartness, grapefruits, citrus, strong red fruits, toffee, light caramel, floral, fair sugar, spices, strong pine, resins, dry bread, lime, strong bitter hops and sharp grass.

Body: Close to medium body. Slick and oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Solid Amber malt in a thick but wheaty background, which slimmed the body considerably (as well as the caramel toffee taste) but not the full Amber bock-ishness. Loads of red fruits with strong grapefruity hops, citrusy spicy and very piney with pretty strong ooze. Flowery with moderate sweetness. Biscuity with strong lime to round. Charming!

Hoppiness: Floral, spices, pine, lemon and grass in nose. Grapefruits, citrus, floral, spices, strong pine, resins, lime, and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness is strong for a lasting, close to high-level bitter Amber malty finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Limey piney and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one is billed as a Session IPA by the Brewer. How wrong they are: it bears all the hallmarks of a good Strong Bitter, with eye-catching copper color and nice head, strong Amber maltyness with lots of red fruits and toast, plus a matching strong citrus piney bitter hops to boost. Were it’s not being bounded at session strength, it may even make a good case to be a nice ESB. Will definitely buy again!

And then you find some gems on the virtual shelves of parknshop.com! The problem was that purchasing 3 Korean beers I've mistakenly ordered a 12-pack of San Miguel... alright this beer is a great finding! Pours copper, translucent, great cream head with perfect retainment and beautiful lacing. Aroma has caramel notes, grapefruit and pine. Tastes bitter, caramel notes, toasted barley, grapefruit peel. Very clean, smooth and creamy, light and absolutely crushable. Great value and a pretty decent beer!

Darker Amber with lose but fluffy thick foam

Nose: Ginger, copper, 

Taste: very nice mellow smooth and slight hop.  Tends to be sweet

Can from a random corner store, near the Gyeongbokgung Palace referenced on the label. Dark amber, and bright. Older school than most old school IPAs. Light body, chewy, biscuity, but also some honeyish, floral hops. Not as bitter as you'd think...it's just an amber ale. I suppose a well made one but a little bit silly to call it IPA because it sets the expectations higher than they should be.

(Can) Pours clear amber / copper with pale amber head. Pleasant fruity aroma - citrus mainly - maybe hints of pine and toffee. Light body and rather fizzy. Flavour is rather watered down. There’s some toffee sweetness and some hard to place fruitiness. There’s hoppy bitterness in the finish. Pale ale, not IPA By taste IMHO, although aroma suggests IPA. Definitely drinkable, but rather attenuated taste.
16 ounce can. Pours a copper color with a medium white head. A soft floral toast nose. Somewhat sweet, toasted malts, light oranges. Not really an IPA, but a bit fruity.
